data.name: Middle Sum is Whom
data.description:
Given an initial array of unique numbers, find the pair of elements from the middle-sum value of an ascending array of the sum of possible pairs in the array. 

Note:
  1. The returned pair should be in order with the initial array.
  2. Even arrays should (by definition) use the second of the middle sum values. See Example One.
  3. If the middle sum value has multiple pairs, return the pair that has the first appearing number in the initial array. See Example Two:

Example One:
```ruby
array = [6,7,25,15] # should return [6,25]
"""
The sorted array of the sum of all pairs is [13, 21, 22, 31, 32, 40]  
The middle sum value is 31. Returned pair is [6,25]
"""
```
Example Two:
```ruby
array = [3,8,9,4] # should return [3,9]
"""
The sorted array of the sum of all pairs is [7, 11, 12, 12, 13, 17]  
The middle sum value is 12. Its sum pairs are [8,4] and [3,9]. 3 appears first in initial array.
Returned pair is [3,9]
"""
```
